titleStmt.title: To LORD & LADY GRANVILLE,Granville George Leveson-Gower, 2nd Earl Granville (1815-91; Dictionary of National Biography), Whig statesman; Minister for Foreign Affairs 1851-2; Maria Louise Kämmerer van Worms-Dalberg (1813–1860), the only child of Emmerich Josef Wolfgang Heribert, Duke of Dalberg, and the widow of Sir Richard Acton (1801-37), seventh baronet, of Shropshire. Granville was President of the Privy Council from 1852-4; in this role he interacted with CD concerning the incorporation of the Guild of Literature and Art. In 1855 he became leader of the Liberal Party in the House of Lords. 23 APRIL 1854

body.p: Mr Charles Dickens greatly regrets that he is so unfortunate as to be engaged on Saturday the sixth of May, otherwise he would have had much pleasure in accepting the kind invitation with which Lord and Lady Granville have honored him
